lead_paragraph: INTERNATIONAL A3-10 Clinton and Arafat Meet, With Expectations Low President Clinton and Yasir Arafat met twice at the White House to explore ways of overcoming Palestinian objections to the president's latest Mideast peace proposals. With Mr. Clinton having less than three weeks left in office to forge a complex accord and with new bursts of violence in the Mideast, expectations of a breakthrough were low. A1
